passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • The Rio de la Plata is one of the largest estuaries in the world. • It is formed by the confluence of the Paraná and Uruguay rivers. • The estuary is located between Argentina and Uruguay. • The Rio de la Plata has significant economic importance for both countries, as it is a major shipping route.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to explain the economic importance of the Rio de la Plata?

choices.A: The Rio de la Plata, formed by the confluence of the Paraná and Uruguay rivers, serves as a major shipping route for both Argentina and Uruguay.
choices.B: The Rio de la Plata is one of the world's largest estuaries, located between Argentina and Uruguay.
choices.C: The confluence of the Paraná and Uruguay rivers results in the Rio de la Plata, which is an estuary shared by Argentina and Uruguay.
choices.D: Argentina and Uruguay both have coastlines along the Rio de la Plata, one of the largest estuaries in the world.

explanation: A: 'The Rio de la Plata, formed by the confluence of the Paraná and Uruguay rivers, serves as a major shipping route for both Argentina and Uruguay.' is the correct answer because it clearly explains the economic importance of the Rio de la Plata by highlighting its role as a major shipping route for both Argentina and Uruguay.

'The confluence of the Paraná and Uruguay rivers results in the Rio de la Plata, which is an estuary shared by Argentina and Uruguay.' is incorrect because it does not mention the economic importance of the Rio de la Plata.
